text.p: Following are some of the main
stories in Dutch newspapers today. Reuters has not verified
these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
HET FINANCIEELE DAGBLAD
- ABN Amro Bank conducts talks about selling its merchant
bank subsidiary MeesPierson. (p1)
- Steel and aluminium giant Hoogovens and loss-making
Belgium steel maker Boel plan to form, a 50-50 joint venture.
- Retailer Ahold sets up a joint venture with Spanish
company Caprabo to take over 10 supermarkets in Spain. (p1) -
Post and telecom concern KPN plans to turn its cable unit into a
large public company. (p1)
- Technical wholesaler Geveke takes over the Dutch and
Belgian wholesaling activities of Hengstler. (p3)
- Korea's industrial conglomerate Samsung makes high demands
on taking over bankrupt planemaker Fokker. (p3)
- ABN Amro Bank provides Dfl 100 mln export credit for South
Africa's state development company. (p3)
- DAF Trucks plans to decrease production of trucks in the
short term. (p5)
DE VOLKSKRANT
- Insurer Aegon decreases its mortgage interest by 0.5
percent. (p2)
- Paper industry wants to collect 85 pct of old paper in
- Environmentalists write to parliament that leasing a car
should me made more expensive every year. (p2)
DE TELEGRAAF
- Not received
TROUW
- Minister for overseas development Jan Pronk criticises the
role of the United States in the Worldbank. (p6)
- Pensionfund PGGM will take companies' environmental policy
into consideration when purchasing assets. (p7)
ALGEMEEN DAGBLAD
- Bank insurer Fortis Amev would be the ideal partner for
MeesPierson says union FNV. (p11)
- Junior economic affairs minister sets apart an extra Dfl
123 mln to support export. (p13)
--Amsterdam newsdesk +31-20-504-5000
